intro: Jatropha cleomifolia, commonly known as the tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers and distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Jatropha cleomifolia is also known for its ability to attract butterflies and other pollinators.
